about.title: About Aggrow
about.description1: Aggrow is an innovative agricultural technology platform designed to help farmers optimize their crop yields through data-driven insights and AI-powered recommendations.
about.description2: Our mission is to empower farmers with cutting-edge technology that simplifies decision-making, reduces resource wastage, and maximizes productivity while promoting sustainable farming practices.
about.description3: Founded by a team of agricultural experts and technology enthusiasts, Aggrow combines traditional farming wisdom with modern machine learning algorithms to provide practical solutions to everyday farming challenges.

diseaseDetection.title: Disease Detection
diseaseDetection.description: Identify plant diseases early through image recognition technology. Simply upload a photo of your affected plant, and our AI will diagnose the issue and suggest treatment options.

cropRecommendation.title: Crop Recommendation
cropRecommendation.description: Get personalized crop suggestions based on your soil composition, local climate data, and market trends to maximize your yield and profitability.

fertilizerRecommendation.title: Fertilizer Recommendation
fertilizerRecommendation.description: Receive tailored fertilizer recommendations based on soil tests and crop requirements to ensure optimal plant nutrition while minimizing environmental impact.

cropRecommendation.title: Crop Recommendation
cropRecommendation.subtitle: Enter the soil and climate details to get a recommended crop.
cropRecommendation.subtitle2: Find optimal crops for your land.
cropRecommendation.locationError: Unable to get your location. Please select state and city manually.
cropRecommendation.geolocationNotSupported: Geolocation is not supported by your browser. Please select state and city manually.
cropRecommendation.locationDeterminingError: Error determining your location. Please select state and city manually.

diseaseDetection.title: Disease Detection
diseaseDetection.description: Upload an image of the plant leaf to detect diseases.
diseaseDetection.noFileError: Please upload an image before submitting.

Apple___Apple_scab.name: Apple Scab
Apple___Apple_scab.description: Fungal disease causing dark, scaly lesions on leaves and fruit.

organic.2: Apply sulfur spray every 7-10 days in spring

Apple___Black_rot.name: Black Rot
Apple___Black_rot.description: Causes rotting fruit with concentric rings and leaf spots.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.name: Cedar Apple Rust
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Orange-yellow spots on leaves with fungal growth underneath.

organic.1: Remove nearby juniper/cedar trees if possible

Apple___healthy.name: Healthy Apple Tree
Apple___healthy.description: Your apple tree shows no signs of disease!

prevention.1: Prune annually to improve air circulation
prevention.2: Apply dormant oil spray in late winter

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.name: Cherry Powdery Mildew
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery coating on leaves and shoots.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.name: Healthy Cherry Tree
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.description: Your cherry tree is in excellent condition!

prevention.2: Apply balanced fertilizer in early spring

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.name: Corn Gray Leaf Spot
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: Rectangular tan lesions with yellow halos on leaves.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.name: Corn Common Rust
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Small cinnamon-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.name: Northern Corn Leaf Blight
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Long, elliptical gray-green lesions that turn tan.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.name: Healthy Corn
Corn_(maize)___healthy.description: Your corn plants are growing well!

care.2: Side-dress with nitrogen when plants are knee-high

Grape___Black_rot.name: Grape Black Rot
Grape___Black_rot.description: Brown lesions on leaves with black fruit rot.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).name: Esca (Black Measles)
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: Chronic wood disease causing leaf discoloration and berry spots.

management.1: Prune infected wood (disinfect tools between cuts)

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.name: Grape Leaf Blight
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Angular brown spots with yellow halos on leaves.

care.1: Train vines for good air circulation
care.2: Monitor for pests like Japanese beetles

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).name: Citrus Greening (HLB)
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Yellow shoots, lopsided fruit, and bitter juice.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.name: Peach Bacterial Spot
Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Small dark spots on leaves and fruit that may crack.

Peach___healthy.name: Healthy Peach Tree
Peach___healthy.description: Your peach tree is in great condition!

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Leaf Spot
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Small water-soaked spots that turn brown on leaves.

care.3: Harvest regularly to promote more fruit

Potato___Early_blight.name: Early Blight
Potato___Early_blight.description: Concentric rings on leaves with yellow halos.

Potato___Late_blight.name: Late Blight
Potato___Late_blight.description: Water-soaked lesions that rapidly destroy foliage.

chemical.1: Apply fungicides preventatively in wet weather

Potato___healthy.name: Healthy Potato
Potato___healthy.description: Your potato plants are growing well!

care.1: Hill soil around stems as plants grow
Rotate with corn or small grains

Squash___Powdery_mildew.name: Powdery Mildew
Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery coating on leaves that yellows and dies.

organic.1: Milk spray (1 part milk to 9 parts water)
organic.2: Baking soda solution (1 tbsp per gallon)

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.name: Leaf Scorch
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Purple spots with white centers on older leaves.

Strawberry___healthy.name: Healthy Strawberry
Strawberry___healthy.description: Your strawberry plants are producing well!

care.2: Use straw mulch to keep fruit clean

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Spot
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Small water-soaked spots that become scabby on fruit.

Tomato___Early_blight.name: Early Blight
Tomato___Early_blight.description: Target-like rings on lower leaves that spread upward.

organic.2: Stake plants for better air flow

Tomato___Late_blight.name: Late Blight
Tomato___Late_blight.description: Rapidly spreading water-soaked lesions in cool, wet weather.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.name: Leaf Mold
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Yellow spots with olive-green mold underneath leaves.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.name: Septoria Leaf Spot
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Small circular spots with dark margins and gray centers.

organic.1: Remove lower leaves up to 12 inches

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.name: Spider Mites
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Tiny yellow stippling on leaves with fine webbing underneath.

organic.1: Spray with water to dislodge mites

Tomato___Target_Spot.name: Target Spot
Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Brown spots with concentric rings and yellow halos.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.name: Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Upward curling leaves with yellow margins, stunted growth.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Mottled light and dark green patterns on leaves.

care.1: Prune suckers below first flower cluster

fertilizerRecommendation.title: Fertilizer Recommendation
fertilizerRecommendation.noCropError: Please select a crop before proceeding.
fertilizerRecommendation.description: Enter soil parameters and crop type for customized recommendation.

N_max.title: Nitrogen content is HIGH
N_max.balance: To balance the nitrogen levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Avoid N-rich fertilizers (composted manure, blood meal).
organicTreatment.2: Add carbon-rich materials (straw, sawdust) at 2–3 tons/ha.

inorganicTreatment.1: Avoid nitrogen-rich inorganic fertilizers like urea or ammonium nitrate.
inorganicTreatment.2: Leach excess nitrogen by applying moderate irrigation to wash away soluble nitrogen compounds.
inorganicTreatment.3: Apply nitrification inhibitors to slow down the conversion of ammonium to nitrate, reducing nitrogen losses.

N_min.title: Nitrogen content is LOW
N_min.balance: To balance the nitrogen levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Add nitrogen-rich organic fertilizers such as composted manure, blood meal, or fish emulsion.
organicTreatment.2: Use green manure by growing and tilling nitrogen-fixing cover crops like alfalfa or clover.
organicTreatment.3: Apply well-decomposed compost to slowly release nitrogen and improve soil structure.

inorganicTreatment.1: Apply nitrogen-rich inorganic fertilizers like urea (46% N) or ammonium sulfate (21% N).
inorganicTreatment.2: Grow legumes like beans, peas, or clover to fix atmospheric nitrogen into the soil.

P_max.title: Phosphorus content is HIGH
P_max.balance: To balance the phosphorus levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Avoid phosphorus-rich organic fertilizers like bone meal, rock phosphate, or fish bone meal.
organicTreatment.2: Apply compost with low phosphorus content to balance soil nutrients.
organicTreatment.3: Use mycorrhizal fungi inoculants to enhance plant phosphorus uptake and reduce excess soil phosphorus.

inorganicTreatment.1: Apply gypsum (calcium sulfate) to bind excess phosphorus into insoluble calcium phosphate.
inorganicTreatment.2: Use potassium sulfate (0:0:50) instead of phosphorus-containing fertilizers to maintain crop nutrition.
inorganicTreatment.3: Adjust soil pH to 6.5–7 by adding lime (if acidic) or sulfur (if alkaline) to optimize phosphorus availability.

P_min.title: Phosphorus content is LOW
P_min.balance: To balance the phosphorus levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Add phosphorus-rich organic fertilizers such as bone meal, rock phosphate, or fish bone meal.
organicTreatment.3: Apply compost with balanced nutrient content to provide a slow release of phosphorus.
organicTreatment.4: Use mycorrhizal fungi by inoculating the soil with fungi that enhance phosphorus uptake by plant roots.

inorganicTreatment.2: Apply phosphorus-rich inorganic fertilizers like DAP (18:46:0) or TSP (0:46:0).
inorganicTreatment.5: Adjust soil pH to 6–7 by adding lime (if acidic) or sulfur (if alkaline) to improve phosphorus availability.

K_max.title: Potassium content is HIGH
K_max.balance: To balance the potassium levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Stop applying potassium-rich organic fertilizers like wood ash, manure, or compost high in plant-based materials.
organicTreatment.2: Incorporate carbon-rich, low-potassium organic matter (straw, sawdust, shredded paper) to dilute the potassium concentration and improve soil structure.
organicTreatment.3: Grow potassium-demanding crops (e.g., potatoes, beets) to gradually remove excess potassium from the soil over time.

inorganicTreatment.1: Avoid potassium-containing inorganic fertilizers such as potassium chloride (KCl) or potassium sulfate (K2SO4).
inorganicTreatment.2: Apply gypsum (calcium sulfate) to displace potassium ions and increase their leaching potential in well-drained soils, with careful monitoring.
inorganicTreatment.3: Leach the soil with large volumes of water (if drainage permits) to remove excess potassium, but be mindful of potential environmental impacts.

K_min.title: Potassium content is LOW
K_min.balance: To balance the potassium levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Add potassium-rich organic fertilizers such as wood ash, kelp meal, or greensand.
organicTreatment.2: Use cover crops like buckwheat or alfalfa to accumulate potassium in the soil.
organicTreatment.3: Apply banana peel fertilizer to improve potassium levels naturally.

inorganicTreatment.1: Apply potassium-rich inorganic fertilizers like muriate of potash (MOP, 0:0:60) or sulfate of potash (SOP, 0:0:50).
inorganicTreatment.2: Use water-soluble potassium fertilizers like potassium nitrate (13:0:45) for quick availability.

pH_max.title: pH Level is HIGH
pH_max.balance: To balance the pH levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Add acidifying organic materials like pine needles, peat moss, or composted oak leaves to lower soil pH.
organicTreatment.2: Incorporate organic matter such as compost or manure to improve soil structure and reduce alkalinity.

inorganicTreatment.1: Apply acidifying inorganic materials like elemental sulfur or aluminum sulfate to lower soil pH.
inorganicTreatment.2: Use acid-forming fertilizers like ammonium sulfate (21% N) to gradually reduce soil pH.
inorganicTreatment.3: Leach excess alkalinity by applying moderate irrigation to wash away soluble salts.

pH_min.title: pH Level is LOW
pH_min.balance: To balance the pH levels in the soil:

organicTreatment.1: Apply agricultural lime (calcium carbonate) at 2-5 tons/ha to gradually raise pH.
organicTreatment.2: Add wood ash (1-2 tons/ha) for quick pH correction and potassium supply.
organicTreatment.3: Use composted eggshells or oyster shells (500-1000 kg/ha) for slow pH adjustment.

inorganicTreatment.1: Apply dolomitic lime (CaMg(CO₃)₂) at 1-3 tons/ha to raise pH and add magnesium.
inorganicTreatment.2: Use hydrated lime (Ca(OH)₂) at 500-1000 kg/ha for rapid pH increase (caution: strong effect).
inorganicTreatment.3: Mix calcium oxide (quicklime, CaO) at 200-500 kg/ha for severe acidity (wear protective gear).
